definition[0]: an occasion when someone is asked to come back, especially for another job interview
example[0]: Managers often request callbacks in order to find out more about the candidate or to introduce him or her to other members of a department.
definition[1]: a telephone call that you make back to someone who called you earlier
example[1]: More than half of the problems are resolved promptly by the agency and do not require callbacks to customers.
definition[2]: an occasion when a customer takes goods back to a store, or complains about goods or services, because there is something wrong
example[2]: We used to get two or three callbacks a month for unlevel cabinets, and now we don’t get any.
definition[3]: an occasion when someone has to go back in to work in order to deal with a serious situation there
example[3]: Employees receive double the normal rate of pay for a callback on the employee’s regular day of rest.
